regulations.views.redirect module¶

regulations.views.redirect.diff_redirect(request, label_id, version)[source]¶

Handles constructing the diff url by pulling the new version from GET. We check for bad data here (as we can’t rely on url regex)

regulations.views.redirect.order_diff_versions(label_id, version, new_version)[source]¶
regulations.views.redirect.redirect_by_date(request, label_id, year, month, day)[source]¶

If a user requests a date as the version, find the version which was current as of that date

regulations.views.redirect.redirect_by_date_get(request, label_id)[source]¶

Handles date, etc. if they are part of the GET variable. We check for bad data here (as we can’t rely on url regex)

regulations.views.utils module¶

regulations.views.utils.add_extras(context)[source]¶
regulations.views.utils.first_section(reg_part, version)[source]¶

Use the table of contents for a regulation, to get the label of the first section of the regulation. In most regulations, this is -1, but in some it’s -101.
